executable.title: Fracture reconstruction SL
executable.description: Provides algorithmic core functionality for bone fragment alignment process.

string-vector.name: fragmentModelFineTuning
string-vector.label: Fragment model for fine tuning
string-vector.description: Set fragment models for fine tuning

boolean.name: useReference
boolean.label: Use predefined reference polydata file (optional)
boolean.description: If you have a predefined reference polydata file containing metadata like curvature and texutre information computation will be faster

boolean.name: useCoordinates
boolean.label: Use coordinates for alignment
boolean.description: Use coordinates to select points for registration (should not be checked when no manual pre alignment was performed)

boolean.name: useNormals
boolean.label: Use normals for alignment
boolean.description: Use normals to select points for registration

boolean.name: useCurvature
boolean.label: Use curvature for alignment
boolean.description: Use coordinates to select points for registration

boolean.name: useTexture
boolean.label: Use texture features for alignment
boolean.description: Use coordinates to select points for registration

boolean.name: fineTuning
boolean.label: Perform fine tuning only
boolean.description: If set to true only fine tuning of the fragments using only fracture surfaces will be performed

string.name: slicerTempPath
string.label: Path to folder in which temp files are stored
string.description: You can provide a path in which some advanced parameters can be predefined

string.name: settingsFileName
string.label: Name of file containing parameter settings
string.description: You can provide a file in which some advanced parameters can be predefined

string.name: initialTransformName
string.label: Predefined Transform (optional):
string.description: You can use a predefined transform to used initially to pre-align a fragment to the reference label

string.name: outputDirectory
string.label: Predefined output directory for debugging purposes (optional):
string.description: Here you can specify a directory where output files for debugging purposes will be stored

string.name: outputSuffix
string.label: Output filename suffix (optional):
string.description: Here you can specify a special suffix for output files that are stored for debugging purposes will be stored

transform.name: inputTransform
transform.description: Optional input transform(e.g. from manual initialization)>
transform.label: Input transform

string-vector.name: fineTuningInputTransforms
string-vector.label: Input transforms for fine tuning step
string-vector.description: Input transforms for fine tuning step

transform.name: outputTransform
transform.description: Transform that aligns fragment to reference
transform.label: Output transform

string-vector.name: fineTuningOutputTransforms
string-vector.label: Transform outputs after fine tuning step
string-vector.description: Transform outputs after fine tuning step

geometry.name: referenceModelInput
geometry.label: Input reference model (optional)
geometry.description: Reference model including calculated attributes(curvature, normals, texture features). Can be used for further runs, so that features do not have to be calculated from scratch

geometry.name: candidateModelInput
geometry.label: Input candidate model(optional)
geometry.description: Optional candidate model including calculated attributes(curvature, normals, texture features). Can be used for further runs, so that features do not have to be calculated from scratch

geometry.name: referenceModelOutput
geometry.label: Output reference model
geometry.description: Reference model including calculated attributes(curvature, normals, texture features). Can be used for further runs, so that features do not have to be calculated from scratch

geometry.name: fragmentModelOutput
geometry.label: Aligned model
geometry.description: Aligned model including calculated attributes(curvature, normals, texture features used for analysis and fine tuning step

boolean.name: useICP
boolean.label: Use ICP algorithm for alignment
boolean.description: Using ICP insteal of EM-ICP is a lot faster, but also less accurate!

integer.name: maxICPIterations
integer.label: Maximum number of iterations for ICP
integer.description: Set maximum number of iterations for ICP registration algorithm (more iterations = slower = better results)

boolean.name: UseCoordinates
boolean.label: Use point coordinates to select candidate points

boolean.name: UseCurvature
boolean.label: Use curvature to select candidate points

boolean.name: UseNormals
boolean.label: Use normals to select candidate points

boolean.name: UseTexture
boolean.label: Use texture features to select candidate points

executable.parameters:
EM-ICP parameters
decimationFactor --decimationFactor Surface point decimation factor Amount of decimation for surface points used for feature calculation (e.g. 0.4 means decimation to 40%) 0.4
pointPercentageEMICP --pointPercentageEMICP Point perct. for EM-ICP (in %) Amount of decimation for surface points used for feature calculation (e.g. 0.4 means decimation to 40%) 0.4
sigmaInf --sigmaInf Value for sigma-inf. Value that determines stopping criterion for EM-ICP value (lower values = more itertions) 1 0.1 50
sigmaFactor --sigmaFactor Value for sigma-factor Value that determines the decimation of sigma after every iteration for EM-ICP value (lower values = more itertions) 0.99 0.5 0.9999
histogramBins --histogramBins Number of histogram bins Specifies the number of histogram bins that shall be used for the calculation of the Haralick texture features 150 5 5000
cylinderLength --cylinderLength Length of cylindric VOI used for texture calculation Determines length of the cylinric VOI that will be used to compute texture features for each surface point 4 2 20
cylinderRadius --cylinderRadius Radius of cylindric VOI used for texture calculation Determines length of the cylinric VOI that will be used to compute texture features for each surface point 4 2 20
maxPointDistanceMulti --maxPointDistanceMulti Maximum point distance between adjacent fragments Determines the maximum distance between the fracture srufaces of two pre-aligned fragements. Points with larger distance will not be used for fine tuning registration 5 0.1 20
maxCrestCurvatureMulti --maxCrestCurvatureMulti Maximum curvature value for crest points Determines the maximum distance between the fracture srufaces of two pre-aligned fragements. Points with larger distance will not be used for fine tuning registration -0.1 -0.5 0.5
Curvature values that determines if point is likely to be on the fracture crest. Points with higher value are likely to be not part of the fracture crest
